Legal_Issue: Whether the Commission breached procedural fairness by not providing sufficient reasons for dismissing the complaint
Procedural_Stage: Judicial review following dismissal of complaint
Evidence_Assessment: Investigator recommended further action; Commission dismissed complaint despite recommendation
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate breach of procedural fairness
Legal_Rule: Section 42(1): Reasons required only if complaint not dealt with at screening stage; Section 44(3): No requirement to provide reasons for dismissal
Procedural_Issue: Lack of written reasons for dismissal
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; complaint dismissed without full investigation
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation of Canadian Human Rights Act
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No duty to provide reasons under s.44(3); no breach found
Key_Evidence_Considered: Investigator's report, DFO's response, Mr. Armoyan's rebuttal
Applicant_Challenge: Commission failed to provide adequate reasons
Defendant_Response: DFO provided response to allegations during investigation
Remedy_Sought: Set aside Commissionâ€™s decision and require reconsideration with reasons
Legal_Provision: s. 42(1), s. 44(3) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Authority: Canadian Human Rights Commission, Federal Court
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to provide reasons does not render decision unreasonable or procedurally unfair
Applicable_Process: Complaint screening, investigation, Commission dismissal, judicial review
